message: My question is, now that all major browsers do full page zoom rather than just changing the text size, is there any downside to going back to using pixel measurements everywhere?
To my knowledge, the only browser that couldn't resize pixel spec'd text was IE6.
However, this question is based on a disputed point—that full page zoom is a wholesale replacement for text-zoom. Accessibility experts will tell you it's not.
So, I know the techniques for sizing everythign with ems so that text resizes work gracefully
I guess that's what I'm really concerned about... is full page zoom good enough for accessibility? If not, why not?
